NAEB HEADQUARTERS
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
FUNDACION CREOLE
Apartado 889
Caracas, Venezuela
September 27, 1957
The National Association of Educational Broadcasters
14 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Ill.
Gentlemen:
The Education Faculty of Central University here in Caracas is
considering the formation of a Committee to Study the Educational Uses of
T. V. in Venezuela. The Creole Foundation, it is expected, will be asked
to provide financial aid for such a study.
We believe that perhaps our most effective assistance would be to
make it possible for a competent U.S. organization to make available some
U. S. technical personnel, with the necessary experience in the educational
T. V. field there, to work with the local Committee in planning and organizing
the study.
The purpose of this letter is to enquire whether or not your organizaÂ¬
tion would be in position to provide this service on the basis of a grant
from this Foundation. It goes without saying that before any final decision
on the project is made, you would be thoroughly briefed on what the job
would entail, so that a detailed project proposal could be prepared by you.
This, in accordance with usual foundation practice, would then be the basis
of our submission to our Board for final action.
If you are interested in such a possibility, I would appreciate
hearing as soon as possible so that we will have it in mind when we discuss
the project with the local Committee.
Yours very truly,
/s/ E. E. Maes
E. E, Maes
Deputy Executive Director
Copied NAEB Headquarters 10/7/57dfc
